name:ID: The document contains a summary of assessment criteria for glazing.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The criteria include product information, thermal insulation performance, shading coefficient, and visible light transmittance.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product information should be provided on the packaging of the product and/or company website.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product information should include instructions on installation, adjustment, and protection of the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product information should include U-value, solar heat gain coefficient, and visible light transmittance.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product information should include recommended maintenance for the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The product information should include details related to the end of service life of the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Documentation related to the label and relevant information should be provided.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification of the product information is required.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Points are awarded for the product information.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The thermal insulation performance of the product should meet certain requirements.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Laboratory test report(s) on the U-value of the entire glazing product are required.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Points are awarded for the thermal insulation performance.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The shading coefficient of the product should meet certain requirements.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Laboratory test report(s) on shading coefficient or solar heat gain coefficient are required.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Points are awarded for the shading coefficient.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The visible light transmittance of the product should meet certain requirements.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Laboratory test report(s) on daylight transmittance are required.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Points are awarded for the visible light transmittance.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: HKGBC Green Product Accreditation and Standards [HK G-PASS]
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC).
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: It aims to help consumers, building professionals and policy makers identify environmentally preferable building materials and products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: It governs the application and award of a label under the Scheme.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard neither modifies nor supersedes laws and regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with all applicable laws and regulations is a prerequisite for the manufacturing and marketing of the product.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are, therefore, to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Scheme is owned by the Construction Industry Council (CIC) and implemented by the Hong Kong Green Building Council (HKGBC)
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard sets out the assessment criteria and their benchmarks for glazing products
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The Standard defines the verification methods to determine which labelling grade should be awarded to the product
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Compliance with this Standard is not a substitute for, and does not assure, compliance with any applicable laws or regulations

name:ID: Glazing products are commonly used for fixed and opening windows, window doors, curtain walls and other elements of the building envelop
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building could account for 10 to 25% of a building's exposed surface
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The glazing area of a building serves as an interface to transmit light and provide outdoor view
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Common types of glazing being used in architectural applications include clear and tinted float glass, tempered glass, and laminated glass as well as a variety of coated glasses, etc
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Many of the glazing products contain substances that may be harmful to the environment and human health
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The greatest environmental impact of glazing products is resulted from the energy losses during the building operation stage due to their long technical service life
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The purposes of the assessment criteria developed for glazing are to promote the use of energy-efficient building envelop, and to minimise the environmental impact through stringent assessment criteria on the production process and use of materials
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The scope of this Standard is applicable to glass in fixed and opening windows, window doors, and other elements of building envelop
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Glass blocks and bricks or glass used for internal partitions are excluded from this Standard
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Each application should specify its types and product series
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Subsequent applications can be made for similar products with different thickness and/or coatings under a labelled product series
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A product to be assessed should meet all the minimum requirements of the Core Criteria
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: be awarded a Green Label under the Scheme
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Bonus points may be awarded if the product meets the Non-core Criteria
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: a Bronze, Silver, Gold or Platinum Label will be awarded according to the total points accumulated
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: All submissions and documentations shall be endorsed by the Chief Executive Officer or other authorised personnel
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The chemical tests should be conducted by either a third party or the manufacturer who has received the ISO17025 certification or relevant national accreditation systems.

name:ID: The chemical tests should be conducted by either a third party or the manufacturer who has received the ISO17025 certification or relevant national accreditation systems, e.g. HOKLAS, CNAS, etc.
:LABEL: Node

:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The packaging materials shall: - o Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.

name:ID: Manufacturers have been investigating and adopting innovative technologies to enhance the durability and environmental performance of the glazing products.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Durability and environmental performance of glazing products is advocated in the glazing industry due to the increasing awareness of "green products" among the contractors, architects and end-users, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: For example, high durability of glazing products can reduce resource consumption.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: High durability of glazing products can reduce resource consumption.

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The overall heat transfer coefficient or U-value measures how well a glazing product transfer heat.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: A low U-value indicates the glazing product is well insulated, resulting in a reduction of cooling load.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: In this Standard, the U-value of the single, double or tripled glazing products shall meet the requirements.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification Documentation related to the above product information and instructions, web pages and any other information freely available to customers or the public.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The packaging materials shall: - Not contain halogenated plastics, and - Be comprised of 100% recycled material or be readily recyclable, decomposable, or contain no coatings, impregnated chemicals or other materials that would prevent recycling or decomposition.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: The technology adopted in the glazing manufacturing that can enable the glazing products to reduce resources used in: - o Maintenance, e.g. self-cleaning glass, etc. Or - o Energy, such as lighting, e.g. instantly reactive glazing technology that changes the glass from clear to a dark blue tint, self-tinted glass, etc.
:LABEL: Node

name:ID: Verification Documentation describing the extra environmental features adopted as well as the product functions generated by the technology.
:LABEL: Node
